722976f-a.text:
Rivington Street, nos. 34-42, Manhattan. c.1920 34 Rivington St. is at the far left, across the street. The second building from the right (Insurance') is the law office of Frank & Wolfson; the sign in the window reads "Main Office 299 B'way.' The building at the right, no. 42, is the real estate office of L.
Goldfarb.
Gift of Mrs. Vincent Gilpin, West Chester, Pa.
722976f-a.folder: Rivington Street & Forsyth Street, Manhattan, NY

722977f-a.folder: Rivington Street & Forsyth Street, Manhattan, NY

719780f-a.text:
151-153 Forsyth Street, west side, south of Rivington Street.
July 18, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
719780f-a.folder: Forsyth Street & Rivington Street, Manhattan, NY

722975f-a.text:
34.-28 Rivington Street, at, adjoining, and west of the N.W. corner of Forsyth Street. These buildings will be demolished for the Sarah Delano
Roosevelt Park.
July 18, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
722975f-a.folder: Rivington Street & Forsyth Street, Manhattan, NY

719778f-a.text:
Forsyth Street, east side, at Rivington Street, as seen from Chrystie Street, and across clearance. Shown on the left, is No. 170 Forsyth (also No. 36 Rivington)Street, at the N.E. corner. Opposing same, is P.S. No. 20, occupying the entire south side of Rivington Street, between Forsyth and Eldridge Streets. The tenement houses adjoining the school, are Nos. 156 to 152, and are south of the S.E. corner of Rivington Street. The clearance shown, will be improved, and then known as Sarah Delano Roosevelt Park.
July 23, 1930.
P . L. Sperr.
719778f-a.folder: Forsyth Street & Rivington Street, Manhattan, NY

719779f-a.text:
Foreyth Street, at the N.W. corner of Rivington Street, and showing the rears of buildings which front on Chrystie Street. Note demolition for
the Sarah Delano Roosevelt Park.
July 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
719779f-a.folder: Forsyth Street & Rivington Street, Manhattan, NY

719781f-a.text:
Forayth Street, east side, north from and including Rivington, to and including Stanton Streets, as seen from Chrystie Street, and across clearance.
July 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
719781f-a.folder: Forsyth Street & Rivington Street, Manhattan, NY

719786f-a.text:
(1)
Forsyth Street, north from and including Rivington, to and i cluding East Houston Streets. On the left, appears the west side of Chrystie Street. Clearance between these streets, is being improved by a park
and playground.
April 1, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, slightly northward, from a different angle. This view
shows Chrystie Street in more detail.
March 16, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same point of view as No. 2, but not show ing the Rivington
Street ourb side.
March 16, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
